author: Anonymous Beaker
title: MNR and MR Difference
question:
Hey all,
What's the difference between Mutual Natural Recursion and just regular Natural Recursion
Thanks in advance
student_answer:
Mutual Natural recursion refers to when there are references that basically go in a circle. If you can start at a data definition and follow reference arrows so that you reach where you started, then this is mutual natural recursion.
Natural Recursion,
however
, is when the data definition is self referential (i.e. most primitive type lists like ListOfNumber and ListOfString).
